solution_line_template: Lola climbs {num_stories} stories in {num_stories} stories x {lola_time_per_story} seconds/story = <<{num_stories}*{lola_time_per_story}={lola_total_time}>>{lola_total_time} seconds

Tara can go up the elevator in {elevator_time_per_story} seconds/story x {num_stories} stories = <<{elevator_time_per_story}*{num_stories}={tara_travel_time}>>{tara_travel_time} seconds without the stops at each floor.

The elevator stops for {elevator_stop_time_per_floor} seconds on each floor for a total of {num_stories} stories x {elevator_stop_time_per_floor} seconds/story = <<{num_stories}*{elevator_stop_time_per_floor}={tara_stop_time}>>{tara_stop_time} seconds.
In total it takes Tara {tara_travel_time} seconds + {tara_stop_time} seconds = <<{tara_travel_time}+{tara_stop_time}={tara_total_time}>>{tara_total_time} seconds to reach the top floor.
